title: Mastering the World of Psychology (5th Ed)(gnv64)
description:
Mastering the World of Psychology (5th Ed)
by Samuel E. Wood, Ellen Green Wood and Denise Boyd 
Pearson | July 2013 | ISBN-10: 0205968082 | PDF | 624 pages | 23.5 mb

Mastering the World of Psychology, 5/e, provides students with more support than ever before, thanks to the Survey, Question, Read, Recite, and Review Learning Method, or SQ3R, which is integrated throughout the text. SQ3R shows students the relationship between psychological theory and learning. It is the strongest and most comprehensive program for measuring progress and attaining successful outcomes in Introductory Psychology.
MyPsychLab is an integral part of the Wood/Wood/Boyd program. Engaging activities and assessments provide a teaching and learning system that measures studentsÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ success. With MyPsychLab, students can watch videos on psychological research and applications, participate in virtual classic experiments, and develop critical thinking skills through writing.

About the Authors
Samuel E. Wood received his doctorate from the University of Florida. He taught at West Virginia University and the University of MissouriÃ¢â‚¬â€œSt. Louis and was a member of the doctoral faculty at both universities. Dr. Wood passed away in 2008.
Ellen Green Wood  received her doctorate in educational psychology from St. Louis University and was an adjunct professor of psychology at St. Louis Community College at Meramec.
Denise Boyd  received her Ed.D. in educational psychology from the University of Houston and has been a psychology instructor in the Houston Community College system since 1988.
